Fedora IoT is created by a team in the F: Fedora IoT is created by a team in the Fedora Project community called the IoT Working Group. It is comprised of official members who have decision-making powers, as well as other contributors. Learn more about this group and how you can get involved on the IoT Working Group website.
IoT Working Group meetings are open to a: IoT Working Group meetings are open to all current and potential contributors on Wednesdays, 11 AM US Eastern at fedora-meeting{'@'}irc.libera.chat.
Join a community of users and contributo: Join a community of users and contributors focused on Fedora IoT.
The **Fedora IoT** tag on Fedora's Disco: The **Fedora IoT** tag on Fedora's Discourse-based discussion forum is a great place to connect with other Fedora IoT users and contributors.
The Fedora IoT Working Group sends meeti: The Fedora IoT Working Group sends meeting agendas and minutes and has discussions on their mailing list at iot{'@'}lists.fedoraproject.org.
You can chat with the Fedora IoT Working: You can chat with the Fedora IoT Working Group via either Matrix or IRC: #iot:fedoraproject.org on Matrix and #fedora-iot on irc.libera.chat.
You can view, file, and discuss Fedora I: You can view, file, and discuss Fedora IoT issues on the [Fedora IoT issue tracker](https://pagure.io/fedora-iot/issues).
